intro: Phaeocarpus glabratus, commonly known as the smooth phaeocarpus, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rubiaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant produces small, dark blue to black berries that are often used in traditional medicine. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Its botanical features make it an important component of its native ecosystems.
